div.p: J. Gordon Arbuckle Jr. is an associate professor of sociology at the Iowa State University. His research and extension activities center on improving the social and environmental performance of agriculture, with a particular focus on adaptation of agriculture to climate change, water quality, and agri-environmental policy and practice in general.

Lois Wright Morton is a professor of sociology at the Iowa State University and project director for the Climate and Corn-Based Cropping Systems Coordinated Agricultural Project (CAP). Her research centers on agriculture and natural resource management, specifically water quality, farmer conservation decision making, performance-based environmental management, grassland biodiversity management on working agricultural lands, and farmer response and adaptation to long-term changes in weather patterns.
